item.title: A Savior Is Born—Christmas Video
item.description: A Savior is born. Each Christmas season we celebrate the birth of our Savior—the Son of God, who can save us from sin and sadness. Remember Him, love Him, and follow Him. Visit christmas.mormon.org

item.title: Why we need a Savior — A Christmas message about our Savior Jesus Christ. #ASaviorIsBorn.
item.description: What would life be like without a Savior? There would be no joy, no forgiveness, no hope for the future. This Christmas, learn more about the hope, peace and happiness our Savior Jesus Christ can bring into our lives at christmas.mormon.org.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: The Christmas season is a time to celebrate the priceless gift of our our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. His birth is more than the symbol of a holiday. He is the Son of God and the Redeemer of all mankind. mormon.org/Christmas

item.title: Will I Do My Part?
item.description: The key to freeing our ancestors from spirit prison is in our hands. We have the opportunity to put that key into action and bring the blessings of the Gospel to our families.

item.title: Is Anything Too Hard for the Lord?
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen illustrates the vast work of bringing the ordinances of the gospel to every man, woman, and child who has ever lived on the earth.

item.title: One Son or Daughter at a Time
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen discusses the blessings promised to youth of the rising generation who are turning their hearts to their fathers. Each individual name is important and no one will be neglected or forgotten.

item.title: By the Hand of Elijah the Prophet
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook testifies of the mission of the prophet Elijah. The salvation of the whole human family is interdependent and interconnected—like the roots and branches of a great tree.

category.title: Teacher Training - Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook Video Resources
category.subtitle: Videos: 27

item.title: Studying the Scriptures Sequentially
item.description: Elder Bednar explains how to study the scripture sequentially.

item.title: Lesson Preparation: Verse Segments and Summary Statements
item.description: A teacher learns how to find verse segments within her lesson.

item.title: Lesson Preparation: Identify Doctrine and Principles
item.description: A teacher learns how to identify doctrine and principles within her lesson.

item.title: Lesson Preparation: Decide Which Principles to Emphasize
item.description: A teacher learns how to identify the most important principles for students to learn and apply.

item.title: Lesson Preparation: Determine the Emphasis Level of Each Verse Segment
item.description: A teacher learns how to determine fundamental level.

item.title: Obtain the Word
item.description: A worried teacher gets some advice on how to prepare for and teach lessons.

item.title: Teaching the Scriptures Sequentially
item.description: How to improve upon teaching the scriptures sequentially.

item.title: Curriculum Overview
item.description: An overview of the fundamentals in the curriculum.

item.title: The Fundamentals in the Curriculum
item.description: An in-depth review of what the fundamentals are in the curriculum.

item.title: Using the Scriptures and the Teacher Manual
item.description: A teacher learns how to use both in her lesson.

item.title: Introduction to the Teacher Manual
item.description: A teacher gets an introduction to the teacher manual.

item.title: Prophetic Teaching about the Students Role in Learning
item.description: Counsel from Church leaders on the role of students in learning.

item.title: Explain, Share and Testify: Students Testimonies
item.description: Student interviews of how explaining, sharing and testifying helps them.

item.title: A Student-Centered Classroom: An Example
item.description: Excerpts from Sister Wellers seminary class.

item.title: A Student-Centered Classroom: A Teacher’s Reflections
item.description: Sister Weller talks about her experience as a seminary teacher.

item.title: Teaching Students Their Role
item.description: Brother Howell trains his students on their role.

item.title: Asking Questions
item.description: President Eyring advises on the importance of asking questions.

item.title: Asking Questions: Searching for Information
item.description: A teacher brainstorms on how to ask questions to best help students search for information.

item.title: Asking Questions: Analyzing Context and Content
item.description: Examples of how to ask questions to help students analyze context and content.

item.title: Asking Questions: Identifying Doctrine and Principles
item.description: Examples of how to ask questions to help students identify doctrine and principles.

item.title: Asking Questions: Understanding Doctrine and Principles
item.description: Examples of how to ask questions to help students understand doctrine and principles.

item.title: Asking Questions: Inviting Feelings and Testimony
item.description: Examples of how to ask questions to help students invite feelings and testimony.

item.title: Asking Questions: Encouraging Application
item.description: Examples of how to ask questions to help encourage application.

item.title: Three Core Beliefs
item.description: Brother Chad H. Webb uses a personal story to highlight the importance of dedication and careful thought in lesson preparation and teaching.

item.title: Scripture-Centered Teaching
item.description: Brother Chad H. Webb invites teachers to think and talk about how to be even more centered in the scriptures.

item.title: The Lord Knows Every Need
item.description: Elder Scott advises teachers to trust the Lord to enlighten them on the needs of their students.

item.title: Expecting More from Your Students
item.description: Sister Linda K. Burton shares her experience in seminary.

item.title: A Row of Sunday Shoes
item.description: Sunday is the #Bestday.

item.title: Sunday Sounds Different
item.description: Hear the other side. Listen to the sounds of the Sabbath. #BestDay

item.title: Dominoes
item.description: So often, our acts of service consist of simple encouragement or of giving mundane help with mundane tasks, but what glorious consequences can flow from mundane acts and from small but deliberate deeds! …

item.title: Matthew 25:40
item.description: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

item.title: Travelling
item.description: Every day each of us faces a test. It is the test of our lifetimes: will we choose to believe in Him and allow the light of His gospel to grow within us, or will we refuse to believe and insist on traveling alone in the dark?

item.title: Stable Family
item.description: The members of a stable family know who they are, where they are going, and what they want to achieve.

item.title: Family Laboratory
item.description: The home is the laboratory of our lives, and what we learn there largely determines what we do when we leave there.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: God is perfect and omnipotent... He is our Father, he loves us, and he offers the same opportunity to draw closer to him as would a loving friend. And you will do it in much the same way: speaking, listening, and doing.

item.title: General Conference Montage
item.description: The Apostles testimonies of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Light Switch
item.description: Nevertheless, spiritual light rarely comes to those who merely sit in darkness waiting for someone to flip a switch. It takes an act of faith to open our eyes to the Light of Christ.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: A heart filled with gratitude for the blessings of life and an earnest desire to hear and follow the words of counsel will prepare the way for personal revelation

item.title: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath
item.description: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath

item.title: It Will All Work Out
item.description: When we offer our broken heart to Jesus Christ, He accepts our offering. He takes us back. No matter what losses, wounds, and rejection we have suffered, His grace and healing are mightier than all. It will all work out.

item.title: He is there for us
item.description: For many, the infirmity of depression is painful or permanently disabling... Those who suffer this circumstance should remember that our Savior experienced this kind of pain also and that, through His Atonement, He offers the strength to bear it.

item.title: Service
item.description: It is only when we love God and Christ with all of our hearts, souls, and minds that we are able to share this love with our neighbors through acts of kindness and service—the way that the Savior would love and serve all of us if He were among us.

item.title: Tithing: I Will Make a Leap of Faith
item.description: This video illustrates how temple and family history work can help a new member generate the faith necessary to pay her tithing so she can receive the blessings of the temple.
